messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg portrays the billionaire former New York City mayor as a leader who will improve health care coverage, make college more affordable and more. The front of the mailer appears to woo independent voters by promising he'll be a president "for every American."
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This letter from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg emphasizes defeating Republican President Donald Trump in 2020, along with Bloomberg's experience as a business man and New York City mayor.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: In this piece delivered by canvassers, Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Elizabeth Warren pledges to end Washington corruption, make the rich pay higher taxes and address climate change. The flyer is in both English and Spanish.
messages.about: Elizabeth Warren is a U.S. senator from Massachusetts and former director of the Consumer Finance Protection Bureau. She's an attorney who has taught law at Harvard University and other universities.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Ready Colorado Action Fund, a group that supports conservative education reform, says Republican House candidate Tonya Van Beber will support the oil and gas industry, parental rights and choice in education. It says she's a conservative who supports President Donald Trump.
messages.about: Ready Colorado Action Fund is an arm of the nonprofit that advocates for "the conservative vision for education." The group lobbies for school choice at the state level.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This flyer left at a Denver home emphasizes Democrat Mike Bloomberg's work on fighting pollution, for gun control and against tobacco interests as he seeks votes in the March 3 Super Tuesday primary.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This letter from Margaret Brick, mother of a firefighter killed on 9/11, asks Colorado voters to select former New York City Mayor Mike Bloomberg in the March 3 presidential primary. She cites his leadership and accomplishments after 9/11.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democratic presidential candidate and billionaire Michael Bloomberg emphasizes his fight against the National Rifle Association to increase gun control in the United States.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from super PAC Better Jobs Coalition encourages voters in Weld County's House District 63 to vote for Dan Woog, saying he'll fight back against Democratic Gov. Jared Polis and "his radical anti oil and gas agenda." It cites his record defending the industry as an Erie trustee.
messages.about: Better Jobs Coalition is an independent spending group formed by Rick Enstrom, a Republican operative. The group formed in 2016 and supported Republican legislative candidates. The group often gets involved in Republican primary elections and also supports Republcians in general elections.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democrat Michael Bloomberg emphasizes the need for action on climate, claiming that actions by the Trump administration are "destroying public lands." It is true that GOP President Donald Trump is allowing more oil and gas development on public lands, but he also signed a major expansion of wilderness areas in 2019.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This digital billboard at 16th and Arapahoe purchased by Democratic billionaire Michael Bloomberg tosses a classic Colorado insult at GOP President Donald Trump. We're doing a Twitter poll on this one. But we've got a couple of hints that this is false.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Michael Bloomberg criticizes President Donald Trump's health care policies and vows that the billionaire Democrat will improve such policies.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Raising Colorado praises incumbent Democratic Sen. Chris Hansen, who faces Maria Orms in the June 30 primary.
messages.about: Raising Colorado is an independent spending committee that supported candidates in various 2017 and 2015 school board races. The group is now supporting state legislative candidates. They're often seen as being in opposition to teachers unions.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This fancy mailer from billionaire Mike Bloomberg's campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination is aimed at young voters, emphasizing how he'll improve on health care, climate change, educaiton and gun control
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This print ad from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg ran in several daily newspapers in southwestern Colorado, including the Silverton Standard. It emphasizes his leadership as mayor of New York City and on climate and health care.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg features state Rep. Tom Sullivan, whose son was murdered in the 2012 Aurora theater shooting. It emphasizes Bloomberg's work on gun safety, including promoting background checks and "keeping guns out of the wrong hands." Sullivan sponsored a successful "red flag" law in 2019, allowing guns to be removed from those who courts consider a threat to themselves or others.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: Yes, you can actually buy these matches for $3.50 in Democrat Michael Bloomber's campaign store. We'll presume he doesn't want you to use them to light cigarettes? This is an Instagram ad.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Ready Colorado Action Fund says Erie Trustee Dan Woog is a "Trump Republican, Conservative Christian, Job Creator." It mentions protecting the Second Amendment and the Taxpayers Bill of Rights, as well as the "sanctity of life." Although Ready focuses most of its attention on conservative education reform, education isn't mentioned in the mailer.
messages.about: Ready Colorado Action Fund is an arm of the nonprofit that advocates for "the conservative vision for education." The group lobbies for school choice at the state level.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer touts that Republican U.S. Sen. Cory Gardner "is putting Colorado's healthcare first" and "getting results for Colorado families." It tells the recipient to "tell Gardner to keep up the good work" by going to a website that is actually for a real estate business.

The group also is running a Facebook ad with a similar message at a cost of about $2,000. It uses the correct website link.

Because it doesn't mention voting for Gardner in the November election, Compass Colorado doesn't have to disclose how much it spent on the mailer or where the money came from.
messages.about: Compass Colorado is a conservative nonprofit focused on fiscal and economic issues. Republican political consultant Andy George is the director of the group.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This text messages from nonprofit Stand Up America urges people to call U.S. Sen. Cory Gardner, a Republican, and demand that he vote to remove President Donald Trump from office during the impeachment trial.
messages.about: Stand Up America is a nonprofit created in 2016 working to remove Republican President Donald Trump from office. The group is also working to oppose Colorado U.S. Sen. Cory Gardner, a Republican up for re-election.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer for the new super PAC Coloradans for Constitutional Values says Weld County GOP House candidate Tonya Van Beber will support the oil and gas industry and take on Democratic Gov. Jared Polis if elected.
messages.about: Coloradans for Constitutional Values is a recently formed super PAC (techinically independent expenditure committee) that may take unlimted contributions and spend unlimited amounts as long as it doesn't coordinate with candidates or political parties. It is supporting several candidates in the June 30 primary contests.

messages.advertiserName: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado
messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado commends Democratic Sen. Chris Hansen's leadership. Hansen was appointed to the state Senate earlier this year after serving two terms in the House and faces primary challenger Maria Orms. The group sending the mailer is an independent spending committee, which isn't supposed to coordinate with candidates.
messages.about: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado is the independent spending committee for COPIC, which provides liability insurance to doctors.

messages.advertiserName: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado
messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado commends GOP Rep. Colin Larson as a leader committed to getting businesses opened again the face of the coronavirus pandemic. Larson, a Littleton coffee shop owner, faces former state Rep. Justin Everett in the House District 22 primary.

The group sending the mailer is an independent spending committee, which isn't supposed to coordinate with candidates.
messages.about: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado is the independent spending committee for COPIC, which provides liability insurance to doctors.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg emphasizes his career as a businessman, New York City mayor and philanthropist. It says he'll work to make college more affordalbe, ensure affordable health care and get special interests out of politics. He's among several candidates on Colorado's March 3 primary ballot, and is self-funding his campaign.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from nonprofit Healthier Colorado urges the recipient to call Sen. Rhonda Fields, an Aurora Democrat, to encourage her to vote in favor of a public otion health care plan. The recipient, however, lives in Denver, not in Fields' district.

While Gov. Jared Polis and Democratic lawmakers planned to itroduce a public option health care plan, the legislature went on haitus March 14 because of COVID-19. They are scheduled to return March 30, but it's unclear if that will occur. The mailer says the public option will reduce premium costs and increase health care options for Coloradans.

Meanwhile, Partnership for America's Health Care Future, a coalition of health care, insurance and business groups, has spent more than $1.6 million on TV ads and mailers to oppose the public option.
messages.about: Healthier Colorado is a nonprofit advocating for a state public option health care plan that would provide coverage for all Coloradans.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This letter from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg criticizes Republican President Donald Trump, saying he "creates chaos everywhere he goes." Bloomberg cites his work as New York City mayor and as a business person. He's among several candidates on Colorado's March 3 primary ballot, and is self-funding his campaign
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This door hanger is from Republican Dan Woog in the open House District 63 seat in the Weld County portion of Erie. The flyer mistakenly says that Woog is an Erie trustee, but his term ended in April after he served since 2013. 

Woog won a primary contest for the seat, and faces Democrat Geneiveve Schneider, of Dacono, in the general election.

messages.advertiserName: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado
messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado commends GOP Rep. Colin Larson for being "pro-life, pro-2nd Amendment and pro-liberty" as well as being a fiscal conservative. Larson faces former state Rep. Justin Everett in the June 30 primary.

The group sending the mailer is an independent spending committee, which isn't supposed to coordinate with candidates.
messages.about: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado is the independent spending committee for COPIC, which provides liability insurance to doctors.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This is the second mailer from Compass Colorado, touting that Republican U.S. Sen. Cory Gardner "puts our healthcare first" and that "Colorado families can count on Senator Cory Gardner to deliver real results." The text is slightly different than the initial mailer, with somehwat different photos and background.

It tells the recipient to thank him by going to a website that is actually for a real estate business, not the Compass Colorado site, as in the original mailer.

The group also is running a Facebook ad with a similar message at a cost of about $2,000. It uses the correct website link.

Because it doesn't mention voting for Gardner in the November election, Compass Colorado doesn't have to disclose how much it spent on the mailer or where the money came from.
messages.about: Compass Colorado is a conservative nonprofit focused on fiscal and economic issues. Republican political consultant Andy George is the director of the group.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Conservation Colorado commends Sen. Julie Gonalzes and Rep. Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez for "voting to protect our environment 100% of the time." That's based on the environmental nonprofit's 2019 legislative scorecard that ranked lawmakers on their votes on climate issues, public health, improved air quality and protecting the environment. It's among several mailers the group sent coinciding with the opening of the 2020 legislative session Jan. 8. Gonzales-Guiterrez is up for re-election later this year.
messages.about: Conservation Colorado is a nonprofit environmental group that works on climate change, protecting land, water and wildife. The group supports candidates, mostly Democrats, who support their legislative initiative.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Conservation Colorado commends Sen. Julie Gonalzes and Rep. Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez for "voting to protect our environment 100% of the time." That's based on the environmental nonprofit's 2019 legislative scorecard that ranked lawmakers on their votes on climate issues, public health, improved air quality and protecting the environment. It's among several mailers the group sent coinciding with the opening of the 2020 legislative session Jan. 8. Gonzales is not up for re-election until 2022.
messages.about: Conservation Colorado is a nonprofit environmental group that works on climate change, protecting land, water and wildife. The group supports candidates, mostly Democrats, who support their legislative initiative.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This door hanger distributed in Democratic Rep. Kyle Mullica's district criticizes him for sponsoring a bill to increase regulations surrounding vaccine exemptions, although it is incorrect about some of its allegations. The hanger mentions pharmaceutical company GlaxoSmithKline, which hasn't donated to Mullica's campaign or those of other lawmakers in recent years. Mullica received two donations totally $300 from pharmaceutical companies in his 2018 campaign, for which he raised more than $128,000.
messages.about: Colorado Health Choice Alliance is a nonprofit that wants to protect exemptions in Colorado law for parents who don't want to vaccinate their children.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from super PAC Better Jobs Coalition says Republican Rep. Colin Larson has what it takes to reopen Colorado and get people back to work after the coronavirus pandemic. Larson, a Littleton coffee shop owner, faces former state Rep. Justin Everett in the House District 22 primary.
messages.about: Better Jobs Coalition is an independent spending group formed by Rick Enstrom, a Republican operative. The group formed in 2016 and supported Republican legislative candidates. The group often gets involved in Republican primary elections and also supports Republcians in general elections.

messages.advertiserName: Partnership for America's Health Care Future
messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Partnership for America's Health Care Future opposing a public health insurance option arrived on the opening day of the 2020 legislative session when the Democratic-controlled General Assembly will consider enacting such an option. The national nonprofit is an alliance of hospital, insurance and pharmaceutical groups that oppse a single-payer health care system at the state or federal level. The group is also airing TV and digital ads in Colorado opposing the public option.

The mailer claims health care would cost more, hospitals would close and that politicians would control health-care decisions citing reports by a business partnerhip and the Colorado Hospital Association.

Consumer groups are supporting the public option.
messages.about: The Partnership for America's Health Care Future is a nonprofit with a variety of members including insurance companies, health care providers, chambers of commerce, the Colorado Farm Bureau and more. The coalition opposes proposals by some Democratic presidential candidates to create a government-run health care system that would be available to all and eliminate private health insurance.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This basic text from Democrat Andrew Romanoff's campaign asks a voter to committee to vote for the former state House speaker in the June 30 primary versus former Gov. John Hickenlooper. The winner will face incumbent Republican Sen. Cory Gardner

This mailer from Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg pledges "No chaos. No nonsense," while describing how unaffiliated voters may cast their ballots in the March 3 Colorado presidential primary.
messages.about: Michael Bloomberg is a former New York City mayor who made billiosn through a career in financial services, including Bloomberg News Service.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This robocall praises President Donald Trump for taking action to end Chinese travel in late January, while criticizing Democratic challenger Joe Biden. FactCheck.org has deemed the call misleading. The call also has been used in other states.


"I'm calling to give you an important update on President Trump's response to COVID-19 and how it saves American 's lives despite Beijing Biden's attempts to rewrite history and downplay China's role in the coronavirus pandemic. President Trump's decision to restrict travel to and from China on January 31st, 2020, saved millions of lives. Beijing Biden accused President Trump of hysteria, xenophobia and fear mongering before finally agreeing with President Trump's decision in April. Beijing Biden's son Hunter signed a $1.5 billion deal with a Chinese investment fund and made $80,000 per month from China in the months leading up to the coronavirus outbreak. President Trump is the right person to lead us through the coronavirus pandemic, and his first priority is the health and safety of the American people. Not his family's pocket book. This call is paid for by the Colorado Republican Committee."
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This text message encourages the voter to support former Gov. John Hickenlooper in the June 30 Democratic Senate primary against former state House speaker Andrew Romanoff. The winner will face incumbent GOP Sen. Cory Gardner in November.

This mailer from super PAC Coloradans for Constitutional Values says that Grady Nouis, a Republican candidate for House District 48 in Weld County, is a convicted drug criminal. A Denver Post story in 2018 noted that Nouis pleaded guilty to "maintaining a drug house" and marijuana possession when he was 21 in 2005, some 15 years ago. Nouis lost a Jefferson County House contest in 2018, then moved to Milliken and is running in a Weld County primary there.
messages.about: Coloradans for Constitutional Values is a recently formed super PAC (techinically independent expenditure committee) that may take unlimted contributions and spend unlimited amounts as long as it doesn't coordinate with candidates or political parties. It is supporting several candidates in the June 30 primary contests.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from new super PAC Make Liberty Win encourages voting for Republican Grady Nouis in the Weld County House District 48 primary. It says he supports the oil and gas industry, cutting taxes and schools.

It also includes and "alert" that the voter might be contacted after the mail-in ballot election "to ensure you were treated fairly."
messages.about: Make Liberty Win is a new super PAC (independent expenditure committee) formed June 1 to support House candidates Jusitn Everrt, Vicki Marble and Grady Noius. The group is based in Virginia, and appears to be a subsidiary of a national super PAC with the same name.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from the American Dream Alliance says GOP state Rep. Colin Larson will help end the coronavirus lockdown and restore freedom, and notes that he received a top rating from a conservative education organization. The super PAC has yet to file the required 48-hour notice of this independent expenditure.
messages.about: The American Dream Alliance is a super PAC (techincally an IRS 527) that is funded by the Colorado Association of Home Builders.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This pre-primary mailer from SEIU COPE endorses both candidates – former Gov. John Hickenlooper and former state House Speaker Andrew Romanoff – in the Democratic U.S. Senate primary. It notes they support the union's platform of union voices, higher wages, racial and immigrant justice, affordable health care, paid sick leave and more.

The winner of the June 30 primary will take on incumbent GOP Sen. Cory Gardner.
messages.about: SEIU COPE, the Service Workers International Union Committee on Political Educaiton, is a federal PAC representing workers in one of the nation's largest unions.

messages.advertiserName: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado
messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the super PAC Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado praises Democratic Sen. Chris Hansen for his work on health care affordability. Hansen faces Maria Orms in the Denver-based Senate District 31 primary on June 30.

The group sending the mailer is an independent spending committee, which isn't supposed to coordinate with candidates.
messages.about: Assuring Quality Healthcare Access for Colorado is the independent spending committee for COPIC, which provides liability insurance to doctors.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from former state Rep. Justin Everett insinuates support from President Donald Trump, which has landed Rep. Dave Williams in hot water with the Trump campaign according to a report in Colorado Politics. The mailer includes a quote from Williams, identifying him as a "Trump surrogate." It also includes a quote from Barb Neville, identifying her as a Trump co-chair. That's a position she held in 2016, but she doesn't have a role with the campaign this year.

Everett left the seat in 2018 in an unsuccesful run for state treasurer. Now he is challenging Rep. Colin Larson in the Republican primary.
messages.about: Justin Everett is a former state House member who finished second in the three-way GOP primary for treasurer in 2018.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from House District 63 Republican candidate Pat Miller takes aim at former Erie Trustee Dan Woog, trying to associate him with 2016 Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. Miller is taking a circuitous route, citing outside spending supporting Woog and opposing Miller by Coloradans for Constitutional Values. Much of that group's money can be traced back to Kathryn Murdoch, who supported Clinton in 2016 and has donated to a variety of Democratic causes.

Woog can't control what outside groups support or oppose him or Miller, because coordination between candidates and super PACs is prohibited. So Miller's allegations apply to the group supporting Woog, but not to the candidate himself.

This mailer from former GOP Rep. Justin Everett attacks his successor Rep. Colin Larson as Everett attempts to win back the seat he gave up to run unsuccessfully for state treasurer in 2018. As he attempts to prove his conservative bona fides surrounding "traditional family values," Everett attacks Larson saying he sides "with the homosexual lobby at the state Capitol," among other things.

Larson received a 40% score from One Colorado in 2019 on LGBTQ issues, voting to ban conversion therapy for gay teens and to allow changes in identity documents for trans people.

It also mentions reopening businesses without government interference.
messages.about: Justin Everett is a former state House member who finished second in the three-way GOP primary for treasurer in 2018.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from super PAC Better Jobs Coalition says Republican Rep. Colin Larson will help reopen schools and provide relief to small businesses after COVID-19 lockdowns. It portrays his opponent, former state Rep. Justin Everett, as someone who was asleep on the job when he served in the legislature before his unsucessful 2018 run for state treasurer.
messages.about: Better Jobs Coalition is an independent spending group formed by Rick Enstrom, a Republican operative. The group formed in 2016 and supported Republican legislative candidates. The group often gets involved in Republican primary elections and also supports Republcians in general elections.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
In these letters to potential Republican voters, 3rd Congressional District candidate Lauren Boebert creates a "contract with Colorado" in which she votes to put "America First," work for limited government, support strong borders and more.

In another letter, she criticizes GOP incumbent Rep. Scott Tipton for voting for a bill that would extend coronavirus aid to cities and towns of less than 500,000 because it would help Boulder. She doesn't mention that several cities and towns in the 3rd CD would benefit from the measure.

In these mailers, 3rd Congressional District candidate Lauren Boebert accuses GOP incumbent Rep. Scott Tipton of supporting the Green New Deal and Democratic Gov. Jared Polis because he supported a bill for renewable energy on public lands. She also says Tipton voted for amensty for people in the country illegally. Tipton has been supportive of measures that help farmers in the 3rd CD hire workers from other countries.

This missive from incumbent GOP Rep. Scott Tipton brands his 3rd Congressional District primary opponent Lauren Boebert as "Lyin' Lauren" correcting allegations she made against him in her mailers. He also shares a tweet from President Donald Trump endorsing him.
messages.about: U.S. Rep. Scott Tipton defeated Democratic incumbent Rep. John Salazar for the 3rd Congressional District seat in 2010 and has served since then. He also served in the state House.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from 3rd Congressional District Rep. Scott Tipton emphasizes his endorsement from Donald Trump. He faces Republican primary challenger Lauren Boebert, a Rifle restaurant owner, in the June 30 primary.
messages.about: U.S. Rep. Scott Tipton defeated Democratic incumbent Rep. John Salazar for the 3rd Congressional District seat in 2010 and has served since then. He also served in the state House.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from super PAC Coloradans for Constitutional Values accuses Republican House District 63 candidate Pat Miller of wanting to ban books. The allegation is from 1994, when Miller ran against incumbent Democratic Congressman David Skaggs. The mailer calls this "liberal PC nonsense" and says such censorship is something to be expected from Gov. Jared Polis and Democrats.
messages.about: Coloradans for Constitutional Values is a recently formed super PAC (techinically independent expenditure committee) that may take unlimted contributions and spend unlimited amounts as long as it doesn't coordinate with candidates or political parties. It is supporting several candidates in the June 30 primary contests.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Better Leaders, Better Colorado says Democratic Sen. Chris Hansen fights for environmental justice, an economy that works for everyone and making elections more fair. He faces Maria Orms in the June 30 Democratic primary.
messages.about: Better Leaders, Better Colorado is a super PAC supporting Democrats in primaries in the June 30 elections.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Americans for Prosperity Colorado Issue Committe urges voters to support Proposition 116, which would cut the state income tax rate, and Proposition 117, which would require voter approval for many fee increases. AFP says increasing fees is a way for lawmakers to "sneak around" the Taxpayers Bill of Rights and that taxes should be cut.
messages.about: Americans for Prosperity is a national nonprofit founded by industrialists Charles and David Koch to influence politics. The group is especially active in Colorado, conducting grassroots organizing.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from newly created CFV, which appears to stand for Colorado Family Values, attacks incumbent GOP Rep. Colin Larson as "leading the assault on family values." It says Larson ranked higher than any other House Republican by Colorado's "most militant LGBTQ group" when in fact Rep. Hugh McKean also voted for two of the five bills scored by the group in 2019, the only session in which Larson served and was scored. And four GOP state senators ranked at Larson's level or above in 2020.

The description of the bills in question are misleading. Larson voted to ban forced conversion therapy for gay teens and to allow changes in identity documents for trans people.
messages.about: CFV is a super PAC created June 18 to "FIGHT FOR ORTHODOX CHRISTIAN TRUTH/FAMILY VALUES CONCERNING ALL FACETS OF HUMAN SEXUALITY, MARRIAGE, FAMILY LIFE" according to its initial filing. Term-limited Republican Rep. Stephen Humphrey is the organization's filing agent. It is affiliated with the nonprofit Colorado for Family Values.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Unite for Colorado Action, a state super PAC, calls Republican Suzanne Staiert a "practical leader not a partisan warrior." That echoes the slogan "Practical not political" on the candidate's website. The photos used in the mailer are also identical to those on the candidate's website, and it includes a quote from her website.

Staiert faces Democrat Chris Kolker in the Arapahoe County seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Jack Tate. The district is considered to lean Democratic.
messages.about: Unite for Colorado Action - state is a state level super PAC affiliated with Unite for Colorado, a dark money profit that's aired nearly $3 million worth of TV ads attacking Democratic U.S. Senate candidate John Hickenlooper. The state level super PAC is supporting Republican candidates for state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Planned Parenthood Votes Colorado, a state super PAC, criticizes Republican Sen. Kevin Priola for failing to support abortion rights and reproductive health care. Priola's website says he has a "fundamental commitment to the protection of human dignity, beginning at conception and ending at natural death.

Priola faces Democrat Paula Dickerson in an Adams County district that is considered to tilt Democratic in 2020.
messages.about: Planned Parenthood is a nonprofit that operates health care clinics nationwide that focuse primarily on women's health and family planning. Some of the group's clinics provide abortion procedures or pills to induce abortion.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Party says that Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden will raise taxes, endorses the Green New Deal and will open borders, picturing the former vice president with Sen. Bernie Sanders, a Vermont independent.

The mailer cites news articles as sources for its claims. But Biden's plan is to raise taxes on those making $400,000 a year, not on seniors or middle income families (unless you consider $400,000 a year middle income). While his plan to combat climate change resembles the Green New Deal, there are differences that upset activists on the left. The plan would be paid for with higher corporate taxes. It's likely that Biden would reverse many of President Donald Trump's executive orders on immigration, increase work visas that Trump has sharply curtailed and more.It should be noted that Biden voted for funding of a border wall when he was in the Senate in 2006.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward steers voters to a website about Republican state Senate candidate Suzanne Staiert. She's a former deputy secretary of state and now director of the Public Trust Institute, which filed ethics complaints against former Gov. John Hickenlooper, two of which were found to be violations of state ethics laws. The ethics commission determined Hickenlooper, a Democrat who is now running for U.S. Senate, committed two violations of the state's gift ban. But four violations considered were dismissed, and many others were never taken up by the commission.

Staiert faces Democrat Chris Kolker in the Arapahoe County seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Jack Tate. The district is considered to lean Democratic.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC says that GOP state Sen. Kevin Priola has voted against making health care more affordable and coverage of pre-existing conditions, while trying to tie him to President Donald Trump.

Some of the votes cited occured six to nine years ago, while others occurred in 2019. Priola is considered by many a moderate Republican, and isn't getting much outside support from GOP groups thus far. He didn't endorse Trump in 2016 and hasn't endorsed him this year.

Priola faces Democrat Paula Dickerson in an Adams County district that is considered to tilt Democratic in 2020.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colordo Forward cites GOP state Senate candidate Lynn Gerber on coronavirus and her opposition to strengthened vaccination reporting in Colorado, mostly citing Facebook postings. Gerber Facebook "likes" include the anti-vaccination Colorado Health Choice Alliance and Colorado Freedom Force, a group that often posts objections to wearing masks or limiting interaction to limit the spread of coronavirus.

Gerber is challening Democratic state Sen. Rachel Zenzinger in District 19, centered in Arvada.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward criticizes Republican state Senate candidate Suzanne Staiert for transgressions of her former bosses in the secretary of state's office. She was deputy to Secretary Scott Gessler and Secretary Wayne Williams when they were accused of ethics violations, though she was not implicated in those violations. It also notes that Staiert criticized the state ethics commission on Twitter, then deleted the tweets/

Staiert has been central to an ethics investigation of former Gov. John Hickenlooper, however, serving as an attorney for the Public Trust Institute which filed the complaints. The ethics commission determined Hickenlooper, a Democrat who is now running for U.S. Senate, committed two violations of the state's gift ban. But four violations considered were dismissed, and many others were never taken up by the commission.

Staiert faces Democrat Chris Kolker in the Arapahoe County seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Jack Tate. The district is considered to lean Democratic.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage: Only one side of this mailer is available (if you have the other side, send it to fish (@) coloradomediaproject.com). But it paints Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden as a "radical" picturing him with three far-left members of Congress. Some political strategists disagree with this assement, painting the former vice president as a moderate.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward criticizes state Sen. Kevin Priola, a Republican, for votes on issues of reproductive health, saying he voted against requring insurance coverage for basic materinty care (in 2010), against measures to reduce teen pregnancy and more. None of the votes occurred after his Senate election in 2016.

Priola faces Democrat Paula Dickerson in an Adams County district that is considered to tilt Democratic in 2020.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC says Republican state Senate candidate Suzanne Staiert defended a "baseless lawsuit" that cost taxpayers $500,000. Staiert was deputy for Secretary of State Gessler when he was found in violation of state ethics laws for inappropriate spending. Gessler unsuccessfully appealed the case, which cost taxpayers at least $500,000 although his office disposed of some records of the costs.

Staiert faces Democrat Chris Kolker in the Arapahoe County seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Jack Tate. The district is considered to lean Democratic.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward praises Senate candidate Chris Kolker, a financial planner and small business owner, for his values, sense of community and understanding the community's needs. It contrasts him with Republican Suzanne Staiert, which the group has sent several negative mailers about.

Senate District 27 is in Arapahoe County, centered in Centennial.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage: In the third anti-Biden mailer in a week, the Colorado Republican Party warns of "the radical left takeover" of the Democratic Party and presidential candidate Joe Biden. It threatens higher taxes, amnesty and less police funding. Biden has said he'll  raise taxes on those making $400,000 a year and on corporations, but not on the middle class. He hasn't promised less police funding. It's likely that Biden would reverse many of President Donald Trump's executive orders on immigration
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Committee urges people to vote against Democratic U.S. Senate candidate and former Gov. John Hickenlooper because he would raise taxes.

It cites tax hikes he supported as Denver mayor, two of which were statewide ballot iniatives supported by then-Republican Gov. Bill Owens.

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic Sen. Rachel Zenzinger in Senate District 19 based in Arvada emphasizes her leadership and bipartisanship. It notes her work on education, transportation and the Joint Budget Committee.

She faces Republican Lynn Gerber in the November election.

This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward notes awards Sen. Rachel Zenzinger has received for her work as state senator from Arvada's Senate District 19. Business, education and health care groups are included in the list.

Zenzinger faces Republican Lynn Gerber in the Nov. 3 election.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
The U.S. Postal Service sent a mailing with advice about voting by mail that is now the subject of a lawsuit by Colorado Secretary of State Jena Griswold because it includes information that is inaccurate in Colorado. 

Voters in Colorado DON'T have to request a ballot to receive one in the mail. If they're an active registered voter, they'll receive a ballot automatically. The mailer suggests otherwise. You may check your registration information at GoVoteColorado.

Griswold's office also recomends returning your ballot in person the final eight days before Nov. 3, unlike the USPS mailer. 

The mailing apparently went to all 161 million delivery points in the United States at what appears to be the lowest direct mail postage rate of 16.4 cents each, the mailing costs would be more than $26 million. That doesn't include the costs to design and print the mailer.
messages.about: The U.S. Postal Service is a government agency that recently sent mailers to everyone in the United States about voting by mail.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Party portrays former Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper as "protecting criminals not crime victims." It superimposes Hickenlooper's head on a stock image of a man holding handcuffs. At least three of the five people portrayed on the mailer are people of color, including a Cuban immigrant.

Of those pictured, only Promise Lee was pardoned by Hickenlooper for his role in a 1070s slaying when he was 15. Nathan Ybanez and Terrance Wilder also were teenagers when they committee. They and George Sherman are all still in prison because Hickenlooper reduced their sentences but didn't pardon them. Rene Lima Marin was accidentaly released eight years into a 98-year sentence for a video store robbery and was free for six years before being returned to prison. A judge then ordered that he be released, but immigration authorities detained him, resulting in Hickenlooper's pardon.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC criticizes Republican state Sen. Kevin Priola for votes on issues of reproductive health, saying he sponsored several bills to ban abortion including one in 2018, voted against a budget amendment to fund teen pregnancy prevention and against requring insurance coverage for basic materinty care (in 2010).

Priola faces Democrat Paula Dickerson in an Adams County district that is considered to tilt Democratic in 2020.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC says that GOP state Sen. Kevin Priola has voted against making health care more affordable, against allowing people to buy cheaper drugs from Canada and against coverage of pre-existing conditions. One of the votes cited occured nine years ago, while others occurred in 2019.

Priola is considered by many a moderate Republican, and isn't getting much outside support from GOP groups thus far. He faces Democrat Paula Dickerson in an Adams County district that is considered to tilt Democratic in 2020.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mialer from a Democratic super PAC supporting Rep. Brianna Titone emphasizes her work on helping small business before and after the coronavirus as well as her support of science with the slogan "solutions not politics."

Titone faces a rematch with Republican Vicki Pyne in the Arvada House district.
messages.about: Better Colorado Alliance is a super PAC working to elect Democratic state House members.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC says Republican state Senate candidate Suzanne Staiert once threatened a reporter, citing his tweet about being threatened for an expose he said he was doing about the purge of voter rolls in Colorado. Staiert was deputy secretary of state at the time and said she asked the reporter to correct a report about the co-called "purge" because of calls from concerned county clerks. A 9News story concluded that the reporter's blog past was misleading. 

Staiert faces Democrat Chris Kolker in the Arapahoe County seat being vacated by Republican Sen. Jack Tate.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Committee urges people to vote against Democratic U.S. Senate candidate and former Gov. John Hickenlooper because he would raise taxes. The mailer cites tax hikes made when Hickenlooper was governor, but the footnote identified tax initiatives, which must be approved by voters in Colorado, from 2005 and 2007. Hickenlooper didn't take office until 2011. The 2005 initiatives came from Republican Gov. Bill Owens.

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC uses old, now-deleted tweets from former Deputy Secetary of State Suzanne Staiert implying she's a "Trump-like Twitter troll." The tweets criticzed the Colorado Independent Ethics Commission at a time when her boss, former Secretary of State Scott Gessler, was being investigated by the commission. Gessler was found in violation of ethics laws for using state money to travel to a political event, and his unsuccessful appeals of the decision cost the state more than $500,000 in legal fees.

Staiert, a Republican, is now running for the open Senate District 27 seat based in Centennial against Chris Kolker. She's being criticized for her role in successful ethics charges brought against former Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper, who is running for U.S. Senate. She was director of the organization that filed the charges and followed through with legal action before the state ethics commission.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Better Colorado Alliance criticizes GOP Rep. Richard Champion for denouncing mask wearing, saying coronavirus death tolls were "off base" and for voting against a bill to help small businesses struggling because of COVID-19.

Champion faces David Ortiz, a military veteran and activist for the disabled, in this Centennial-based House district.
messages.about: Better Colorado Alliance is a super PAC working to elect Democratic state House members.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from a Democratic super PAC criticizes GOP state Rep. Richard Champion for coronavirus denial, voting for abortion restrictions and against stiffer fines for polluters.

Champion faces David Ortiz, a military veteran and activist for the disabled, in this Centennial-based House district.
messages.about: Better Colorado Alliance is a super PAC working to elect Democratic state House members.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Party accuses former Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper of taking $330,000 from an oil and gas company that caused a deadly explosion at a Firestone home, of taking "illegal private jet trips" and more.

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner, who has used some similar claims in his TV ads, as have his supporters.

A 9News Truth Test noted that the survivor of the Firestone explosion asked that one of the ads be taken down (it wasn't) and that Hickenlooper isn't the only governor who has accepted corporate donations to fund jobs in the governor's office. The most recent Republican governor did too.

Another recent Truth Test of a Gardner ad noted that the Colorado Independent Ethics Commission found Hickenlooper of only two violations among multiple allegations, only one of which involved a plane trip.

This mailer is one of many the state GOP is sending disparaging the Democratic candidate.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Democratic Party notes that Republican Sen. Cory Gardner voted for bills that would criminalize abortion and put doctors who performed them in jail, as well as defunding Planned Parenthood and voting to repeal a law requiring private health insurance to cover birth control.

Gardner faces Democrat and former Gov. John Hickenlooper in Colorado's U.S. Senat contest.
messages.about: The Colorado Democratic Party is the state party organization.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Committee claims that Democratic Senate candidate and former Gov. John Hickenlooper supports a ban on fracking that would damage Colorado's economy.

In reality, Hickenlooper opposes a ban on fracking, though he isn't as vocal a proponent of the oil and gas extraction method as he was when he drank fracking fluid at a public hearing. In a June debate, he said he wanted to make the practice obsolete with a goal of using 100% renewable energy by 2050. But he says he opposes an outright ban.

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner, who receives significant campaign support from the oil and gas industry.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
Just another in a series of mailers targeting Democratic Senate candidate and former Gov. John Hickenlooper for raising taxes or supporting tax increases while he was Denver mayor and governor.

The mailer cites tax hikes made when Hickenlooper was governor, but the footnote identified tax initiatives, which must be approved by voters in Colorado, from 2005 and 2007. Hickenlooper didn't take office until 2011. The 2005 initiatives came from Republican Gov. Bill Owens. 

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Republican Committee resembles an earlier mailer claiming that former Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper let dangerous criminals loose. Hickenlooper is challenging GOP Sen. Cory Gardner.

As with the previous mailer, at least three of the offenders pictured are men of color. And three of them are still under Department of Corrections supervision, only two are free.

Of the five, only Promise Lee was pardoned by Hickenlooper for his role in a 1070s slaying when he was 15. Nathan Ybanez and Terrance Wilder also were teenagers when they committee. They and George Sherman are all still in supervision because Hickenlooper reduced their sentences but didn't pardon them. Rene Lima Marin was accidentaly released eight years into a 98-year sentence for a video store robbery and was free for six years before being returned to prison. A judge then ordered that he be released, but immigration authorities detained him, resulting in Hickenlooper's pardon.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This one in a series of mailers targeting Democratic Senate candidate and former Gov. John Hickenlooper for raising taxes or supporting tax increases while he was Denver mayor and governor.

The mailer cites tax hikes made when Hickenlooper was governor, but the footnote identified tax initiatives, which must be approved by voters in Colorado, from 2005 and 2007. Hickenlooper didn't take office until 2011. The 2005 initiatives came from Republican Gov. Bill Owens. And voters must approve any tax increases, which didn't occur while Hickenlooper was governor.

Hickenlooper is challenging Republican Sen. Cory Gardner.
messages.about: The Colordado Republican Committee is the federal fundraising arm of the Colorado Republican Party.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from the nonprofit Judicial Crisis Network encourages people to call GOP Sen. Cory Gardner and thank him for supporting the nomination of Amy Coney Barrett to the U.S. Supreme Court. The mailer also accuses Democrats of trying to delay the nomination, while citing the number of days some other nominations took. The dark money group also is airing TV ads in support of the nomination.
messages.about: Judicial Crisis Network is a conservative nonprofit that advicates for conservatives nominated to the U.S. Supreme Court.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democratic super PAC Leading Colorado Forward says Republican Lynn Gerber supports arming teachers, citing speeches she's given. Gerber faces incumbent Democratic Sen. Rachel Zenzinger in Senate District 19 based in Arvada.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from a Democratic super PAC praises Sen. Rachel Zenzinger for leading on coronavirus and business, as well as a range of other issues. She Republican Lynn Gerber in the Nov. 3 election.
messages.about: Leading Colorado Forward is a state super PAC working to elect Democrats to the state Senate.

messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from Democratic super PAC Better Colorado Alliance calls Republican Caroline Cornell extreme, a frequent insult aimed at both Democrats and Republicans from the other side. Cornell is challenging Democratic Rep. Tom Sullivan in the House district centered in Arvada and Centennial.
messages.about: Better Colorado Alliance is a super PAC working to elect Democratic state House members.

messages.advertiserName: Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity and Reproductive Rights
messages.aboutTheMessage: This mailer from the Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity and Reproductive Rights encourages recipients to vote in the Nov. 3 election with information about key deadlines. It also refers indirectly to Proposition 115, which would ban abortion after 22 weeks, saying, "there are many reasons someone might consider abortion later in pregnancy, including threats to health or life of the pregnant person or fetal diagnosis."
messages.about: The Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity and Reproductive Rights, or COLOR, is a nonprofit that works for reproductive justice.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from Democratic super PAC Better Colorado Alliance notes that GOP House candidate Vicki Pyne referrred to COVID-19 contact tracers as "government snitches" and made fun of social distancing on Facebook.

Pyne is challenging Democratic Rep. Brianna Titone in the Arvada-based House District.
messages.about: Better Colorado Alliance is a super PAC working to elect Democratic state House members.

messages.aboutTheMessage:
This mailer from the Colorado Democratic Party contrasts former state Rep. Diane Mitsch Bush, a Steamboat Springs Democrat, and Lauren Boebert, the Republican Rifle restaurant owner who defeated incumbent GOP Rep. Scott Tipton.

The mailer depicts Mitsch Bush as an "independent thinker" who will take on drug and insurance companies. It says that Boebert doesn't have a health care plan. 

Boebert's website doesn't have a section on where she stands on the issues.
messages.about: The Colorado Democratic Party is the state party organization.
